title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of PHC
description: A comprehensive assessment covering the concepts, principles, implementation levels, and responsibilities in Primary Health Care within the Kenyan context.

questions.question: According to the 1978 Alma Ata Declaration, which of the following best defines Primary Health Care?

options.text: Specialized medical care provided in tertiary hospitals.
Essential health care based on practical, scientifically sound, and socially acceptable methods.
Free medical services provided solely by the government.
Health care focused exclusively on treating communicable diseases.

questions.explanation: The Alma Ata Declaration defined PHC as 'Essential health care based on practical, scientifically sound and socially acceptable methods and technology, made universally accessible...'
questions.hint: Think about the key pillars: practical, scientific, and socially acceptable.

questions.question: The concept of PHC is often summarized by the 'Five As'. Which of the following are part of this concept? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The Five As of PHC are: Accessible, Acceptable, Affordable, Available, and Appropriate Technology.
questions.hint: Consider factors that make health care reachable and suitable for the community.

questions.question: Arrange the levels of health care provision in Kenya from the lowest (grassroots) to the highest level:
questions.explanation: The hierarchy starts at the Family, moves to the Community (Location/Division), then to the District (focal point), and finally the National level.
questions.hint: Start with the basic social unit and end with the policy-making level.

questions.question: Match the 'Seven Pillars of PHC' with their correct definitions based on the table below:

richContent.content: Study Tip: The Seven Pillars provide the structural foundation for PHC implementation. Understanding the connection between the aspect and its definition is crucial.

pairs.right: Universally accessible to individuals and families
At a cost the community can afford

questions.explanation: Equity ensures access for all; Participatory involves the community; Sustainability ensures affordability; Science ensures valid methods.

questions.question: The 'Three Pots' system is a strategy implemented at the National Level for water purification.
questions.explanation: The 'Three Pots' system is a simple water purification method implemented at the **Family Level**.
questions.hint: Think about where simple, household-based technologies are applied.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ is the body responsible for the planning and coordination of all development work, including PHC activities, at the district level.
questions.explanation: The District Development Committee (DDC) is chaired by the District Commissioner and coordinates all district development.
questions.hint: It is often abbreviated as DDC.

questions.question: Review the responsibilities list below. Which level of health care is primarily responsible for these activities?

richContent.content:
• Identifying health problems in the community
  • Selecting Community Health Workers (CHWs)
  • Providing administrative supervision of CHWs
  • Initiating income-generating activities

questions.explanation: These are the specific grassroots responsibilities of the Village Health Development Committee at the Community Level.
questions.hint: These activities happen directly within the village setting.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe the fair and reasonable distribution of available resources to all individuals so they can meet their basic needs?
questions.explanation: Equity is the fair distribution of resources, ensuring those with the greatest need receive the most attention.
questions.hint: It starts with 'E' and is one of the Seven Pillars.

questions.question: Which of the following are identified as major CHALLENGES in the implementation of PHC in Kenya? (Select all that apply)

options.text: High burden of preventable diseases like malaria and diarrhoea
Over-emphasis on preventive services over curative ones
Curative services consuming ~70% of the health budget
Excessive number of health workers in rural areas

questions.explanation: Challenges include high disease burden, budget skew towards curative services (70%), and lack of referral guidelines. There is usually a shortage, not excess, of workers in rural areas.
questions.hint: Consider where the money goes and what diseases are still common.

questions.question: Analyze the table below regarding PHC implementation. Which 'Way Forward' strategy is best suited to address the issue of 'Drug Resistance'?

richContent.content:
IssueDescription
Resource UseInefficient use of funds/drugs
KnowledgeOutdated skills on new diseases
GovernancePoor policy advocacy

questions.explanation: Drug resistance (like in malaria) requires health workers to continuously update their knowledge and skills through professional development.
